items.title: Johnson and Trump Try to Avoid an Upset House Loss in Tennessee
items.summary: Speaker Mike Johnson put the president on speakerphone during a Monday stop in the state, underscoring the unusual amount of national attention on a House special election.

items.title: For ‘No Tax on Tips,’ the I.R.S. Gets Intimate
items.summary: The Trump administration wants to exclude earnings from “pornographic activity” from a new tax break for tips. Will the I.R.S. know it when it sees it?

items.title: Supreme Court Hears Copyright Battle Over Online Music Piracy
items.summary: At issue is whether internet providers can be held liable for repeated copyright infringements of users, with potentially billions of dollars on the line.

items.title: With Judge's Ruling, a New Tool for Charging Crime in D.C.
items.summary: The U.S. attorney’s office says it may use local grand juries for serious federal crime in Washington “when appropriate” after a judge signed off on the unusual procedure.

items.title: Despite Supreme Court Wins, Elite D.O.J. Unit Has Seen Mass Turnover
items.summary: Even with an exodus of lawyers, the Office of the Solicitor General has had remarkable success. But fiery rhetoric and close White House ties have raised concerns.

items.title: In Georgia, the Fight Over 2020 Election Results Looms Over 2026 Midterms
items.summary: Several officials who were involved in the fight over the election outcome are seeking higher office.

items.title: Trump backs Hegseth as defense secretary denies ordering second strike on boat – US politics live
items.summary: <p>President’s remarks come amid calls for an immediate investigation into reports Hegseth ordered a second strike on alleged drug-smuggling boat</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/dec/01/trump-maduro-ultimatum-relinquish-power-venezuela">Trump reportedly gave Maduro ultimatum to relinquish power in Venezuela</a></p></li></ul><p>The president has picked up where he left off before Thanksgiving, when it comes to his anger at the six Democratic lawmakers who took part in a video urging service members to “refuse illegal orders”.</p><p>A reminder, that Trump initially went on a Truth Social tirade, accusing the members of Congress (all of whom are veterans or former intelligence officials) of sedition, adding that their actions are “punishable by death”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/dec/01/donald-trump-pete-hegseth-caribbean-boats-venezuela-immigration-us-politics-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’
items.summary: <p>Why has Trump blown up alleged narco boats in the Caribbean and at the same time decided to let a big time trafficker off the hook?</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/24/visual-guide-us-military-presence-caribbean">Deadly airstrikes and a military buildup: how the US pressure campaign against Venezuela has unfolded in the Caribbean</a></p></li></ul><p>He was a Latin American president accused of colluding with some of the region’s most ruthless narco bosses to flood the United States with cocaine.</p><p>“[Let’s] stuff the drugs right up the noses of the gringos,” the double-dealing politician <a href="https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/pr/juan-orlando-hern%C3%A1ndez-former-president-honduras-indicted-drug-trafficking">once allegedly bragged</a> as he lined his pockets with millions of dollars in bribes and turned his country into what many called a narco-state.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/01/trump-pardon-juan-orlando-hernandez-honduras-former-president">Continue reading...</a>
